documentType: Federal Bureau of Prisons Monthly Project Report
summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons monthly Building and Facilities (B&F) project report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) covering July 2019. It details the status, funding, and progress of nine construction and maintenance projects, including asbestos abatement, door replacements, and facility repairs. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's infrastructure work during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

events.title: Project Approval for PBX Replacement
events.description: Project approval received for project 2D3U 'Replace PBX'. Procurement documents were initiated.

events.title: Project Approval for Gun Locker Construction
events.description: Project approval received for project 2D3N 'Construct Gun Locker'. An RCA packet was prepared and sent for approval on July 26, 2019.

events.title: Financial Closure Submission for Roof Repair
events.description: Financial closure for the roof repair project (2C8V) was submitted to Financial Management.

keyFacts: This report covers nine separate construction and maintenance projects at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) for July 2019.
A major project (2C6Z) involved 'MTA-Lead/Asbestos Removal' with a budget of $2.46 million and was 75% complete, indicating significant hazardous material remediation was ongoing.

The report shows routine facility management activities, including door replacements, cooler repairs, and the construction of a gun locker, providing context on the prison's infrastructure during Epstein's incarceration.
All projects list a single Facility Manager, identified only by the initials 'AW'.
The document is a standard administrative report with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, victims, or associates, focusing solely on BOP facility operations.
